logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo1JH5GVUXL8M28currentClick) { return cv_mo1JH5GVUXL8M28currentClick(); } } } Length:: 1:18 MinsI purchased the Sony DSC-W350 camera because I wanted a smaller unit to carry on trips or while on vacation. The specs on this model really impressed me, so I was pretty excited when I started opening the box. My initial impression was favorable, because this camera is extremely small and the button layout seemed to be designed in a logical fashion. The battery is a rechargeable lithium-ion model (non-memory type), which took around two hours to charge on the included external battery charger. Additionally, this camera uses Memory Stick Pro Duo or SD/SDHC memory cards for storage. I had a SanDisk 2GB card left over from a Sony PSP memory upgrade and it worked without a hitch. The battery and memory card are stored in the bottom of the camera and the protective door is pretty flimsy. I'm usually pretty careful with electronic devices, but I could see the battery/memory door breaking after repeated use. As far as pictures and video are concerned, I feel the camera fell short on performance. I used the default settings to take some pictures indoors and they were either blurry or washed out from the powerful flash on this unit. Also, I don't think this unit has a red-eye reduction feature, because all my shots with people had red dots. My other cameras have the red-eye reduction feature, so it was definitely missed on this camera. As far as video is concerned, some of my footage was out of focus in some places. I know this is primarily a still camera, but I really wanted the video capability to shine. So, here is a rundown of the pros and cons of this camera:PRO:1) Compact Size (fits easily in shirt pocket)2) Wide-angle lens3) Panoramic mode (still photo only)4) 720p HD Video5) 14.1MP Photos6) Non-Memory Rechargeable BatteryCONS:1) Auto-focus is hit and miss. Hard to tell on 2.7" LCD screen if picture is actually focused properly2) No optical viewfinder3) Focus during video mode is poor4) Flimsy battery/memory door5) Included wriststrap needs a slide to secure properly (i.e. Wii Remote wriststrap). Camera almost flew out of my hand a few timesIn conclusion, I'm not happy with this camera and I am returning it tomorrow. I am not an expert photographer by any means, but I have two other digital cameras and five camcorders which perform better than this unit. I want a true point-and-shoot camera, not something that requires me to fool with a ton of settings to get good pictures.***UPDATE (6/6/10)***To replace this camera, I purchased the Nikon Coolpix S4000. It worked better "out of the box" with its red-eye reduction... no "glowing pupils" on people or pets! Pictures look great and it has a slightly bigger LCD viewfinder than the Sony (3" vs 2.7"). Also, the video looks good with the Nikon. I'm a little bummed though, because I saw the Nikon S6000 today at my local military exchange for the same price as the S4000! It even came in special "promotial packaging" with a genuine Nikon carrying case and a 2GB memory card. Too bad, the big-blue electronics store charges a 15% restocking fee on their digital camera returns! Doh!***UPDATE (9/21/11)***I updated the review to clarify the compatibility with memory cards. Previously, I mentioned that the camera only uses Memory Stick Pro Duo cards only. This is not correct. The camera uses Memory Stick Pro Duo or SD/SDHC memory cards. Sorry for any problems this may have caused with some folks. My original opinion, however, is still the same about this camera... I was disappointed. Nikon Coolpix S4000 = Much better, in my opinion!

Reviews.Title: Good Performance in Lowlight
Reviews.Author: Sujit Kumar Mahapatra "Sujit"
Reviews.Content: I have used almost 10 compact cameras as of now and this one is my favorite when it comes to low-light photography. This camera addresses my most common problem of taking family pictures inside house where in the lighting condition are not ideal. I specifically brought this after reading reviews from AMAZON and i was not disappointed. Thanks again Sony!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Aaron Dahl
Reviews.Content: I have had seven digital cameras now. I have considered Sony many times in the past but was always turned off by that stupid proprietary memory stick. Now that they have finally adapted to the SD card, I could seriously consider buying one.I bought this camera about a year ago to replace my malfunctioning Canon Elph. This Sony camera is simple to operate, and the images come out great. The optical zoom, quality lens, and the stabilization help with this effort. The big crystal clear screen is great and permits viewing even in high ambient light levels. As an architect, I am pretty hard on my digital cameras - they get shoved in my pocket, dropped on the ground, and left in my 150degree car on hot summer days. This camera has taken this abuse like a champ, never let me down. The only negative I can possibly come up with is that the mode selector (for regular photos, panoramic, and video) is right along the edge of the camera - I sometimes inadvertently hit this and find myself shooting a video when I mean to simply take a photo. This is not a significant problem and hopefully Sony will consider this on their upcoming designs.I have now taken about 6,000 photos with the camera, and would definitely recommend it. I will consider another Sony when this one eventually meets it's last photo.

Reviews.Title: Nice Little Camera!
Reviews.Author: Jarrod
Reviews.Content: I've been using this camera since January of 2011. I've had great success with it. It shoots beautiful HD video. My only main problem is the auto focus can get annoying at times. There is no way to turn it off either. I also have some weird noises every now and then when I record. Other than that, the camera works great. I use it to make videos on YouTube and also to take pictures with. It's got a lot of different picture settings and many options to choose from. I only paid $100 for it and I'm very pleased. I would recommend it to anyone that likes to make videos or take pictures on the go.

Reviews.Title: Great gift!
Reviews.Author: Luis Eugenio Santos
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a gift for my aunt (her camera was stolen). She loved it! Specially because it's pink. It has all the good features of a Sony - easy to use, great image quality. The big display is also a plus. One thing that I really didn't like is the N-type battery - it is smaller, but it also means it doesn't last as long as a G-type. With the big LCD, this means you MUST have a spare battery or you'll run out of juice in the middle of your day. At least if you are on vacation, using this camera constantly. It's a great camera, you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Charlene A. Norton "geek grandma"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small camera that I could keep in my purse and always have with me. This fit the bill. I also wanted to have clearer pictures and faster processing than my old digital camera. What I love most about this camera is that it is smarter than me! It is not just a point and shoot...it knows what it is looking at and makes the right choice of settings! I use to hate to try to find a setting in a hurry to catch a quick shot. Now I don't have to. The camera does it for me. Close up? No problem...camera knows! Back-lit? Camera knows...landscape...camera knows...portrait...camera knows...group shot...camera know when they are smiling! Oh to be so smart!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value for the Money
Reviews.Author: Amy Russell
Reviews.Content: I was surprised by how affordable this camera was.  I bought it to take on trips abroad, and I was particularly looking for a camera that was portable, would take good pictures without a tripod, and worked well in low-light conditions with no flash.  I've had issues on past trips where lots of my pictures came out blurry because I couldn't use flash in a church or around art, so that was a top priority for me.  This camera got good reviews at CNET, so I took a chance.First of all, the size is perfect.  It fits in my pocket with no problems, and I am not someone who wears baggy pants.  The only issue I had was that there is a sliding selector for shooting mode (camera, panorama, or video) that I kept hitting when I pulled it out of my pocket.  Not a huge deal, but occasionally annoying.  Second, the pictures really did come out great.  I had a few that were blurry, but only about 1-2% of the total.  Some of it was me, some of it was the camera.  I was impressed with the picture quality.  I was also impressed by how quickly I could snap a shot and turn away.  The camera took a few seconds to process, but there was very little shutter lag, so I could take the picture and move on (a big plus in crowded, touristy areas).  Third, the camera worked AWESOME in low light with no flash.  I took pictures in rooms that were almost dark and they looked fabulous--not blurry or dark at all.  I held the camera as still as I could, but the image stabilization really did it's job.Finally, I liked how easy it was to take a panorama.  You just slide a selector on the back of the camera down one click and hold the shutter down while you sweep the camera in the direction of the arrow on the screen.  It couldn't be easier.  Zoom is not available in panorama mode though, and it is very picky about making sure you move in the right direction.  If you try to move the camera off of the line it wants you to follow, it will give you an error message (straight lines only, no veering off).  The video worked well enough, but you need to move slowly at first to make sure the camera knows what to focus on (or you'll get a blurry video) and it's a little awkward to stop the video, so you should plan on a little editing later.Additionally, I would recommend getting some large SD cards (I went with 8GB, which will give you about 1,500 pictures) and setting the camera down to 10MB for most photos.  I got a second battery (a cheap one from an Amazon merchant), which was very necessary.  I was averaging 200+ pictures a day on my most recent trip, and I just about ran down 2 batteries each day.  I never use flash, but I used lots of zoom, took panoramas, and spent plenty of time moving in and out of various lighting conditions.  This is the first camera I've had that's been able to keep up with me.  I felt like the pictures I got at the end of the trip matched the memories I had, which more than I can say for many of the other cameras I've tried.

Reviews.Title: Excelente!!!!
Reviews.Author: R. Tadeo Ceron Torres
Reviews.Content: Excelente la cámara, estoy encantado, tiene un buen de funciones muy prácticas, el modo Easy te simplifica muchas cosas; toma las fotos super rápido y el modo panorámico funciona de maravilla. Estoy encantado con ésta cámara, tenía antes una Sony también, la cual perdí, y por eso compré ésta, hace todo lo que debe hacer y muy bien. El tamaño es perfecto y el colo genial!!!

Reviews.Title: The Perfect Sized Pocket Cam with Quality to Match!
Reviews.Author: JJ Casas "jjcasas.me"
Reviews.Content: As of now, I'm a pretty big Sony camera user: I have had the Sony w180, Sony w290, and now this camera the Sony w350. Not to mention that I photograph semi-professionally with my trusted Sony a700 and Zeiss lens (jcasasphotography.com - shameless plug =) Anyways, this camera is definitely a gem to use. It's the perfect weight and size that can stay in my pocket everyday. I even chose this over the Sony hx5 even though that camera surely had better specs. My main purpose though is to have a good camera on me all the time. Even with the Sony w290, the large bulge in my pocket made it uncomfortable to carry the entire day. With the w350, it simply can be forgotten in my pocket as it's that small.Use is straight forward: I personally keep mine in Program mode and try to never zoom to retain the 2.7 aperture. [Zooming jumps the aperture beyond 2.7--this is why zoom lenses with a constant aperture of 2.8 are really expensive] That is to be noted as well for any photographers out there knowing their apertures and shutters: this is one of the few cams that has an aperture of 2.7 for this price! Many other Sony Cybershots start at 3.5. With an aperture of 2.7, it definitely allows you to gather plenty of light for low-light photography.I also chose this camera over the PowerShot series because of the Sweep Panorama mode. While I don't expect to print a panorama anytime soon, it's a great option to really capture some great scenery if you don't have your DSLR + ultra wide angle lens on you. I know that you can stitch together individual photos but this mode makes it extra easy to do so with some pretty good results.HD video is good enough in my opinion. For me, it definitely beats carrying multiple devices [I'd rather get a pocket camera that can shoot HD video than a Flip or comparable video camcorder that can shoot stills]Battery life is something I'd like more of. I was able to achieve more from the w290 in my opinion but with the low price of this camera, it's definitely affordable to get a spare battery.All in all, I couldn't be anymore happier with this camera. The Sony Cybershot family is great indeed and it'll have to be something really special for me to switch to a Canon in the pocket camera series.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: S. Jones
Reviews.Content: Good camera. Sleek and easy to use. Pictures are very clear [use 5M] and the flash-recharge time is quick. I love the Sweep-Panorama mode.DOWNSIDES:battery lifehard to take battery outslight hum when shooting video, audible during playback [not bad though at all]zooming is noisy when shooting video,but again  not bad at allThose downsides definitely should not be a turn-off, this is a great camera, feels sturdy, and the pictures are amazing! Great little camera for the price.Would reccomend!

Reviews.Title: Wanted to like this camera but couldn't...
Reviews.Author: Thomas Urrea "sleepymrtt"
Reviews.Content: This camera has a lot of things going for it, but probably just as many things bringing it down. The major problem with it, which was a deal-breaker for me, is that there is noticeable distortion near the left and right edges at wide angle. It's pretty bad and it extends far enough into the frame to turn some shots into a fun-house mirror. Well, it's not quite that bad but when you look at some pictures you're probably going to notice it. You sort of get the feeling that they were trying to go too wide with the technology used. I would rather they had gone with a 28mm equivalent lens if it would have meant that not nearly as much distortion would be present. Secondly, pictures tend to be overexposed, especially when using the flash. Manually reducing the exposure after noticing the picture exhibits those symptoms and shooting again would probably help, but then it's not going to be as easy to use that way. But this brings about another point worth mentioning: the LCD screen is horrible. Everything looks bright and overexposed on it, and it's hard to analyze your pictures using it. Oddly enough, it helped to not look at it from a 90 degree angle but instead around 45 degrees. There's also not much clarity in the pictures themselves. People come out soft quite often. Finally, auto-focus has some problems during video that can be pretty annoying. You might change to a subject that's closer or farther and it could be a while before the auto-focus adjusts.That's not to say it doesn't have a number of pretty good features though. It's relatively cheap now, very small, and the battery life is decent (though not great). Somehow, it performs better than many other point and shoots in low light and the HD video with optical zoom is pretty good even if the zoom is noisy (can be heard in video) and jerky. The Sweep Panorama feature makes it easy to take panorama pictures, though they can't be considered high quality. Many reviews say that the higher end Sony cameras do a much better job. As long as your subjects aren't too close to the edges at wide angle, the pictures will come out nice if they don't come out overexposed.I really wanted to like this camera but the distortion and overall picture quality made me look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for a great price!
Reviews.Author: C. Richardson "iPhone addict"
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my hubby, and he absolutely loves it! It's easy to use, we didn't even need to look at the manual. I ordered this on a Friday, and received it on a Tuesday- shipping was fast!! =]I love how it has a smile detector, which is great, especially for taking pics of younger kids. All in all, this is a great point and shoot camera, and I would recommend buying this one. I gave 3 stars for the video function, only because we haven't tested it out yet.

Reviews.Title: great camera!
Reviews.Author: Michael Connolly
Reviews.Content: Nice size, easy to use, takes great pics!The only negative is that you can hear the zoom motor in recorded video.Awesome!

Reviews.Title: Great Versatile Camera
Reviews.Author: Erin
Reviews.Content: We have a digital SLR camera but were looking for a smaller camera that we could put in our pockets and carry around without the bulk. This Sony Cybershot is absolutely perfect. What I've always disliked about point and shoot cameras are the bad flash images and then when you turn the flash off you can't get a clear or bright image! With the Sony Cybershot W350 I keep the flash off the majority of the time and get amazing clear pictures. The image stabilization feature is phenomenal. I can take pictures indoors with low light without the flash and can get clear, well-lit images. I also really like the macro capabilities. I can get really close up images and they are sharp! This camera also has panorama and video. i really love the panorama feature where you just scan the camera from left to right to capture a longer picture. It creates a seamless image of whatever you set your lens to. The video is awesome too. I love this little camera.

Reviews.Title: Love This Camera!
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera!  Saved $40 by purchasing on Amazon, picture quality is crisp and I love te the auto adjustment "smart camera" capability...even in the pitch dark, the pictures are nice and bright!  Great investment and I'm enjoying to the fullest!!!  : )

Reviews.Title: Good!!
Reviews.Author: PriX G
Reviews.Content: It's very sleek and lightweight. The picture quality is just perfect for a camera of this price! If you're looking for the best digital camera from Sony, then this is for you!

Reviews.Title: sony's cybershot has NEVER disappointed me!!
Reviews.Author: mint snow
Reviews.Content: i have owned a sony cybershot since i embarked into digital photography. i have yet to be disappointed in my choices. this camera is no exception. the thing i like most about it is that i can carry this camera anywhere!! it is tiny and can fit in your shirt or pants pocket. it has never failed to give me consistently excellent shots!! i love taking macro photos of flowers. the photos are crisp, colorful and razor sharp (a tripod is always a good idea when getting that close though!). it's instant focusing ability takes a clear picture in no time. i have tried many brands of small digital cameras - canon, nikon, kodak - but this makes them PALE in comparison. i rarely have to edit a photo taken with this camera. it can go anywhere with me with no fuss. the battery life is amazing and holds a charge better than most digital cameras i have tried with only an lcd screen and no viewfinder. i have tried a couple of slr cameras but they are just too bulky for my liking. they take great photos but i am really satisfied with this cameras ability for its size.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: D. Edwards
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera over six months now and I have no regrets. A very good buy. It takes clean photos. No ifs, no buts, no maybe - Simply perfect. Very easy to use straight from the box. You wont regret the purchase.UPDATE - 23 Feb 2012Almost 2 years now having bought this camera and it still takes excellent pictures. I never leave home without it and it has been places - worldwide. It also is very rugged as it continues to be bombarded by my nieces and nephews with now problems. Pictures continue to remain top quality. The battery life is also excellent.This camera allows a novice to take professional looking pictures straight from the box seamlessly at every attempt! Get yours today.

Reviews.Title: Great cam
Reviews.Author: Greg Brooker "TechExpert"
Reviews.Content: I got this a few months ago for my mom. It is a great camera, great video everything. My only wish is that I had gotten one with a little better zoom to catch a few extra shots but this one is great enough. I takes photos fast and with great detail. my only real concern is the lens, several times when turned off the little shutting doors in the front didnt close correctly and I had to turn it on and off again to make it close right. And you can hear the lens system working inside if you listen, this kinda concerns me but it has not given any problems and my mom and I are quite happy with it. Just make sure to get at least a 8GB MMC cuz this cam fills up cards quickly as each pic is about 5-6Mbs in size.

Reviews.Title: Great for travel
Reviews.Author: J. Green
Reviews.Content: Got the camera a day before I traveled to Asia and Africa.  Very easy to use, and the photos were great quality.

Reviews.Title: Loved this camera
Reviews.Author: PJ
Reviews.Content: This camera was such a great deal for the price.  The picture quality is sharp and it's so easy to use.  Switching from picture to video is just a slide of a button.  The video quality is HD.  No fuzzy videos where you can barely make out someone's face.  Plus this thing is compact and lightweight so it's easy to tote in my purse or my pocket.

Reviews.Title: Amaaaaazing!
Reviews.Author: Cynthia K. Fine
Reviews.Content: I got this camera delivered to me yesterday and I already am in love with it. The color choices are awesome. I was sooo amazed by how light and slim this was when I was holding it. It takes great pictures in any scene, although I have not really gone outside to take any, quite yet. The Intelligent Auto is pretty neat and the other features are also. I like how you can show a slideshow and play it with music (either your own, or the music already on there). The panoramic feature seems awesome! I would love to use this in cities, beaches, parks, etc. I am a photographer, so all these things are really helpful for me to learn. I do agree with the customer who said that you can't really hold the shutter button down halfway to focus as easily as some other cameras, but thats not a huge problem. The smile feature is neat also. You just press the smile icon on the pad thing and you shoot the camera at someone's face and it automatically takes a picture. That is really neat. I can't wait to explore more with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Looks great on paper, sometime takes great pictures
Reviews.Author: W. Bailey
Reviews.Content: We researched this camera pretty well, and it seemed like a good fit for what we wanted, and it does sometimes take great pictures. But usually it misses the shot, taking too long to decide what mode to use and often seems like it can't focus even on well lit slow moving objects. The battery will not last for even an event of a couple of hours and replacements are pretty pricey. I am thinking about contacting customer service at Sony to complain about this camera. Also the veiw screen scratches way too easy. The upside is when it decides to actually take a picture they look amazing, the panorama mode is a nice feature, and with a little practice produces good results, The HD video looks incredible, the sound quality is good, but the only way I can play it is using the built-in software on the camera, or upload it to a website. The format is MP4 and I can't find a player or converter that will play it back decently. I would not buy this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product
Reviews.Author: Cindy
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It is compact, takes awesome pictures and is so easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Good for a gift
Reviews.Author: Steven
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as gift for my sister and it is ok. It is easy to use and the quality of pictures is good as Sony use to be. If you look for something handy and will not demand sophisticated functions this is the camera. The really good thing now is this camera can have SD cards instead of the closed Sony-StickPro.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cybershot 14mp review
Reviews.Author: Brittney A. Shackett "Brit"
Reviews.Content: I love this camara!!! I wanted a high megapixal camara in pink and this is the one. It works super fast and takes great pictures. I am so glad I got it.

Reviews.Title: Good camera but can get better
Reviews.Author: C. Cuesta
Reviews.Content: I buy this camera for my Europe trip and select a Sony for the "prestige" of the brand and because I want to try something different of Kodak.The size and weight are excellent but the menu can get better and more practical. The battery runs out super fast. Sometimes I turn it up to take pictures and discover the battery is dead.Another unpractical tool is the cable. It bring together the USB and the AV adapter making it big and uncomfortable to transport.Last but not less important the camera miss the focus when you are in move (photo & video)For me, my old Kodak works better than this one in a lot of aspects. This one is only better in the quality of pictures, the panoramic pictures and that take pictures faster.Lets see how she is when I am in Europe.

Reviews.Title: Jerry
Reviews.Author: G. Schneider "Jerry"
Reviews.Content: The camera works great. My son bought the same one a month before I did. Hard to believe it has all the features for the price. Bought it for my wife, she wanted a point n shoot. Only complaint is it doesn't charge with the USB cord. The battery has to be removed to charge.

Reviews.Title: Enhanced Colors, compact, HD video, but difficult navigation
Reviews.Author: Deepak Radhakrishnan
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera for beginners. I own multiple cameras including SLRs, and this one is a very good camera for taking colorful pictures.The images are more saturated and warmer which makes it a great camera for taking images of kids or color filled environment. This is the bad part about the camera too, as it does not preserve natural colors.Pros:1. Compact2. Very affordable3. Good Video resolutionCons1. Difficult to navigate to settings2. Feels less durable3. Picture quality is bad(like images taken from Mobile Phone)Pro & con: Images are more color-saturated and warmer.

Reviews.Title: Great, Small feature packed point and shoot!  buy without fear!
Reviews.Author: J. Burke
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my Girlfriends Birthday.  She wanted something easy to carry, easy to use and yet still capable of taking a decent photo...This camera delivered and more!  The Smile detection feature is very cool.. the camera automatically detects when someone is smileing and shoots the photo!  It's sure to amuse you and your friends!  the sweeping panoramic feature is also very cool but we haven't used it much yet.The kids love the video feature and which is super easy to use and works well!  The 5 year old already knows how to use it better than we do..All in all, a small point and shoot camera like this will never take as crisp and clear photos as a DSLR, but for a camera smaller than your cell phone, for less that $200 It is really hard to go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Good Buy!
Reviews.Author: VK
Reviews.Content: My friend bought this. Good one, working well for us, sony quality is always good. so, good buy. I Recommend.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Point and Shoot Camera!
Reviews.Author: chikiBABY
Reviews.Content: After unwrapping the package and discovering a Dora the Explorer Box???:)  I found what seems to be an unused in GREAT condition, everything included: camera, cables, CD-Rom, manuals and battery (which was charged) and the proper settings on the camera were up to date. THANK YOU!!! This was the best DEAL ever!!!! (about 50 bucks for a USED camera??...I love it!)The camera is fantastic I love all the features it offers... Merry Christmas to ME!!!!

Reviews.Title: Not bad
Reviews.Author: Jagga
Reviews.Content: Wish the zoom was better but its still a very good compact camera and easy to keep in your pocket.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Jeanne Gambino
Reviews.Content: Love this camera.  So small and light and takes beautiful pictures and great videos.  I've taken it on a lot of trips and it has never let me down.

Reviews.Title: Condition was surprise
Reviews.Author: art newbie
Reviews.Content: I am happy that I was able to replace my camera for so little but the condition wasn't what I expected.  The front plate shows signs of being pried open (small chip and bent from top to bottom).  The lens covers? don't open or close all the way and need a little nudge each time.Would I buy it again? yes, still a great camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: DSC-W350
Reviews.Author: Carl Epple
Reviews.Content: Gave this one to my wife and she likes it very much. straight forward settings and easy to use. Sharp results.

Reviews.Title: exactly what we wanted
Reviews.Author: chris mcglynn
Reviews.Content: we were looking for something easy to use and still get good photos. filled the bill perfectly. three more words

Reviews.Title: Roughly 3 years later
Reviews.Author: Jeremie Todd
Reviews.Content: Pros:very compact. It fits in a pocket without any hasselpanoramic modedecent zoomCons:noisy photos if lighting is not optimumSummary:I use it on trips which I take about 5-6 per year. It takes better pictures than our Galaxy s3 or Galaxy Note 2 but not by a whole lot. I like that it takes very good pictures and if it were to die on me (water, dropped, stolen) I'm not out a hole bunch.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal!
Reviews.Author: Frederick J. Fuller
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I needed to replace a similar camera I ruined by getting it wet. Very satisfied with the price too!

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: Armando
Reviews.Content: I work in diving, use with a housing, take your outstanding photos, the camera that had got damaged and buy the same again

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: S.H.D.
Reviews.Content: Great little camera. It has been fairly simple to use, and it is nice and small for when I want to throw it in my purse at an event.

Reviews.Title: Still love it
Reviews.Author: ShredderX
Reviews.Content: I've been using the camera for three years now. No problems ever and the picture quality is so good. If you need good pictures, drop the iPhone and get a real camera. The quality is so much better.

Reviews.Title: Lot's of noise and bad low light even for a point and shoot... Terrible build quality
Reviews.Author: Dizturbed One
Reviews.Content: First of all, if you are looking at this camera today, it is of no use. There are better camera's for less money because of the huge advancement in tech over the past few years. I had this camera for well over 2 years, and it recently died completely after a year of hassle with the buttons. When I bought it, it was comparable to other compact camera's in the 300 dollar range. It has the shortest life of any point and shoot I have ever owned. Partly because of image quality I couldn't get comfortable with, and mostly because of terrible hardware.Photo's from this camera are decent in decent lighting, although a bit soft. In well lit situations that do not require flash at all, the pictures are quite excellent, although color is slightly dull. The aperture is decent, but it still seems to suffer in low light terribly. My main gripe with this camera is the slow operating time and bad image quality in low light, worsened by a terrible auto shutter and iso adjustment. A complete lack of manual controls over these things only frustrates things further.After about a year, it would get lens errors on occasion and force me to restart, missing the moment most of the time or resulting in an awkward "JUST WAIT A SECOND, I ALMOST GOT IT!" type of moment. Then the circular button pad started rotating in the bezel, rendering it inoperable unless you lightly rotated it back into correct position. Any usage of it however, would rotate it out again. These two problems happened SHORTLY after the 1 year warranty expired. After a year or so of this frustrating circumstance, the mode switch started changing back and forth... By itself. This basically rendered the camera useless, as it would switch to panorama or video mode while taking a picture, and vice versa, with even the slightest jostle of the camera.Decent performing point and shoot in a good size, bad low light performance but that is common in this size of camera (best I've seen is a Canon S100 for low light in a compact). The hardware quality is what ultimately turns me off. I have a 9 year old 2MP Kodak Easyshare that takes better low light pictures and still works fine (my grandma uses it still) and a Samsung Digimax that is 5 or 6 years old, and still works great (again, better low light performance and less noise all around)... Yet this Sony has had 3 major hardware failures within 24 months of owning it, the first rearing it's head after barely a year. Pretty bad considering Sony has complete control over almost all of the hardware they put out, unlike many other companies.

Reviews.Title: Good Small Camera with Panoramic Shots
Reviews.Author: Alexander Flynn "Thorflyn"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera largely for the ability to take panoramic shots.  It takes decent regular shots and video as well.  At first I was very enthusiastic about the camera and took it on business trip to Las Vegas.  I took many shots with the camera and many on Panoramic mode in parks like the Sahara National Preserve, Red Rock Canyon (just outside of Las Vegas) and Joshua Tree National Park.Panoramas are easy to take and produce good quality images.The downside is that the panoramic images are not as high a resolution that you would think - especially in regard to the height.  It also tries to make you take a panorama that is a very large angle.  I suspect the longer it is - the less likely you are able to hold the camera steady (without a tripod) and the up/down movements reduce the height of your image.There are some neat features of the panoramic mode that allow you to take panoramas going in any direction.Would love to take two panoramas from the same position at slightly different angles and have the camera put it together.  Then I could address the height issue.  I really want to print my images in large format and this is difficult to do.  Microsoft has a product that can help with this as well.  Using a GoPro camera and the Mircosoft software you can produce really good panoramas as well, but there is a slight distortion due to the wide angle of the lens in the GoPro.Between the two cameras - I had a lot of great pictures that I really want to print and cover my office with at work.  Now, if I only had more money to do that...

Reviews.Title: A serviceable point and shoot camera.
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: Lots of bells and whistles like 360 degree photos. Photo quality okay. Good for documenting house contents for insurance purposes.

Reviews.Title: Just right
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: Wife loves it. Wonderful features and easy to use despite her lack of tech knowledge. Paning picture works great. Wish I could have found a green one but thats my only complaint so no worries

Reviews.Title: Decent
Reviews.Author: Robert Perez
Reviews.Content: Decent camera.Bought it for my daughter as a point and shoot.I just dont like the long flashes and the double flashing.Also it doesnt use the standard memory card.However it takes good pics and if your not bothered by the dual flashes thecamera is a good buy.

Reviews.Title: hi
Reviews.Author: mohameed
Reviews.Content: Powerful wonderful easy pushes you for creativity Powerful wonderful easy pushes you for creativity Powerful wonderful easy pushes you for creativity

Reviews.Title: Sony Camerea
Reviews.Author: Melanie Clemente
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item for my dad, and he LOVES it! A great upgrade to his old dinosaur of a camera he had before, plus he was able to figure it out on his own. lol

Reviews.Title: OK. Not the best
Reviews.Author: Bill Todd
Reviews.Content: This is a quality constructed compaact camera with a lot of features at a fair price, but the image quality isn't that great. It never has taken a really sharp picture. Some images are better than others, but I believe the optics are cheap.

Reviews.Title: buena camara
Reviews.Author: LISBETH NOGUERA
Reviews.Content: muy buena resolucion de imagen y video es facil de usar muy buena marca buen producto  y llego a tiempo  gracias

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have a dslr, and I still love this camera. Great quality, easy to carry on trips/outings, and easy to adjust settings.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Domingo Ordaz
Reviews.Content: excellente product was what I expected, I loved it, hope to buythank you very much, all very well, immediate response

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Alvaro Fernandez
Reviews.Content: Works great above and bellow water (With Case).The pictures are of suprisingly good quality. I've taken this to glaciers, scuba diving 80 feet bellow and more and I'm am extremely happy with this camera. No complaints over all....- The screen will let you think the pictures are over exposed (especially with flash at night) but when you transfer to the PC they come out great.

Reviews.Title: Shop for another camera
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Hu
Reviews.Content: I've owned a Sony Cyber-shot 3.3 mega-pixel camera since 2000. This camera took very sharp and great photos even with a low 3.3 mega-pixel resolution. I got tired of lugging this bulky camera around when I travelled so I opted for a smaller camera and since I was so happy with the Sony Cyber-shot with the Carl Zeiss lens, I stuck with the brand and bought the DSC-W350 expecting the same quality. Boy was I DISAPPOINTED! Higher mega-pixel does not equate to better pictures. I can't recommend purchasing this camera.

Reviews.Title: SONY CYBERSHOT W350
Reviews.Author: D.C. PARTIN
Reviews.Content: Just love this camera, it makes me glad my other one broke. It arrived on the 1st day of the estimated shipping dates. My only disappointment, which was not the sellers fault was that I had to wait for the battery to charge before I could use it. My favorite is the Sweep Panorama, it is so easy and fun and with the software when you view them it's like a short video clip. I've had alot of fun with this camera so far with no problems!

Reviews.Title: sont dsc-w350 camera
Reviews.Author: J. Mcluckie
Reviews.Content: This has been a very good camera for the price. It has so many different setting you can do almost anything with it. Iwould recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Nice pictures, but flash can be TOO bright.
Reviews.Author: Michael G. Buttgen
Reviews.Content: For a digital camera, this takes really nice pictures. I find the interface and controls for Sony cameras to be very intuitive and simple, and this follows right along with that.My one beef with this camera is the brightness of the flash. It can be SO BRIGHT that it starts to wash out highlights in the photos you take. On some Sony cameras this can be turned down in the settings, but on this it cannot.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality
Reviews.Author: Deepak Gupta
Reviews.Content: This is very good point-and-shoot camera which takes very good pictures. The camera is really simple to use (my daughter loves to take photographs with this). The video quality is really good for the price

Reviews.Title: slow but good
Reviews.Author: Donald Welton "stringnp"
Reviews.Content: my sony dsc-350. takes great pictures, but is slow to activate shutter. a moving object will out of the picture by the time shutter opens and takes the pic.but you learn to work with it. this is my second 350. had a 330, but it tried to swim the river and didn't work afterword. 180 degree picture is the feature that keeps me coming back. newer models seem to made more cheaply . but older models can still be found.great little cam. very pocket sized.

Reviews.Title: 3 1/2 STARS
Reviews.Author: Doctor Kaiser
