} } } Length:: 0:18 MinsIve had this camera for 4 months now.***It takes superb photos outdoors in daytime hours and I mean SUPER GREAT FOR A POINT AND SHOOT. I took some amazing pictures of the Mayans while down in Mexico on vacation.***Like most point and shoot Cameras it takes slighty grainy pictures in low light.***IT takes great panaramic photos. You basically sweep the camera from left to right in a smooth motion and the camera takes three photos which are stitched together by the camera in less than a millisecond without you even knowing it,so in other words, as soon as you take the photo your done. Where as most other cameras you have to stitch together yourself after you upload it onto your computer.*** As far as the HD video that the Camera has? Well its been hit and miss.I mean around 50% of the videos that I try and filmare alway out of focus or it doesnt come into focus until a few seconds later after you start filming, as I am showing youin this video. Thats annoying and cost me a great clip I tried to take in mexico.***Bottom line= is that it takes better quality photos than my other point and shoot "Canon powershot A1000IS" it also has HD video and takes Panaramic pics Which my Canon doesnt but IF I had been using my Canon while down in Mexico instead, I wouldnt have lost that great video that I took of the "IK KIL Cenote swimming hole" but the Sony made up for it whith the award winning photos of the Mayans that I took with it :)

Reviews.Title: It's ok
Reviews.Author: R. Ellis "saphyress"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera two years and would definitely not get this one again.It takes acceptable photos, nothing like I would expect for the difference from my last camera to this one.The video is ok, but I kept having issues with it going in and out of focus, with other cameras with a much lower mp I never had that problem. I did look at reviews and the manual to see if there was some setting to change, but anything I found was not in the options on my camera, and Sony was little help.

Reviews.Title: HAPPY PHOTOGRAPHER
Reviews.Author: Helen Metzka "P Gross Fan"
Reviews.Content: I have two of these cameras now.  This one I purchased as a backup for my underwater photos and videos.  I take one of these cameras everywhere.  They fit in your pocket or purse and take great pictures.  I wish they had a little bit further zoom; but otherwise, it is great.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera!!
Reviews.Author: pdawg256
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for about a year and I absolutely loved it! Never had any problems with it and all my pictures came out looking amazing! I would still have the camera to this day but unfortunately someone stole it at a birthday party. Now I have the Sony NEX-C3 and that's even better!!! All my pictures look like a professional photographer took them, so I guess I'm pretty happy someone stole my Cybershot or else I wouldn't have gotten the camera I have now :pbut the Cybershot is a great camera too!

Reviews.Title: Great for Travel and Everyday
Reviews.Author: C. Wells
Reviews.Content: This is a really good camera, it is small but the quality and features are not at all lacking. Pictures are very crisp and video footage is clear. The camera itself is slim and fits well in a pocket or your bag. Sometimes a DSLR is just too bulky, and this is a good alternative to have on hand for those quick moments or if your traveling it takes up less space when packing and again you will still get stunning photos. This camera would be good for anyone, it is very user friendly and advanced enough for those that want a little more from their camera.

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed -For outdoor use only!
Reviews.Author: Mark L. Naccarelli
Reviews.Content: I have been taking pictures a long time and spent a lot of time researching this purchase. I ended up deciding on this Sony Cybershot. I have to say that after a few months of use, I am really disappointed. This thing is total crap in low light situations. I bought this camera right before Christmas and my pictures were out of focus and unusable. And this was in the daytime with decent lighting. I know how to use a point-and-shoot and even tried a tripod and MANY different settings. That being said, outdoor pictures are sharp and the videos come out fine. As long as you have a very bright day, you'll be fine with this camera. I suppose I could walk around with those light bars with 4 100 gigawatt bulbs on it my dad used in the 60's when I shoot indoors! I thought I couldn't go wrong with a Sony, but boy was I ever wrong.

Reviews.Title: Sony DSC W350 - nice find!
Reviews.Author: nimett1
Reviews.Content: The Sony DSC-W350 is a small, easy to use camera that takes great pictures.  With the panorama and video capabilities, this is a great find at a reasonable price.  I also purchase the underwater housing for this camera and have gotten some surprisingly clear underwater pictures and videos - even at night!  The one downside is that in less than a year, the lense 'cover/shutter' does not always close all the way.  The camera has small buttons which could make it difficult to use for those with larger hands/fingers. This was the second camera purchased, so that we could have a back up for the underwater housing, should the first camera die.  Recommend!

Reviews.Title: poor video quality
Reviews.Author: nature lover
Reviews.Content: Pro - picture quality is very good for most outdoor shots. I've been happy with the color and sharpness of these shots. Cons - video quality is quite grainy. Also, the camera on automatic continually tries to refocus when you are shooting a moving scene so the result is a in-focus/out-of-focus tug-of-war. I haven't been able to figure out how to keep the focus on infinity in video mode. Cons - indoor red eye setting plus flash takes forever (about two to three seconds) to get the shot - by then people are so flash blinded, or have moved (especially children) so that you can't really get the shot you wanted. All in all, I wouldn't recommend this camera for indoor candid shots.

Reviews.Title: An excellent choice for a specific customer
Reviews.Author: Traska
Reviews.Content: This camera is not likely to blow you away with image quality, particularly in low light, but that's really not the point. This is a very small and compact point and shoot that is ready to take a picture in seconds. That should be what you're looking for if you are considering this product.Pros:- Very small and very light. I pocket this in my jeans day after day and often forget that it's there.- Excellent battery life. With light picture taking, it can go all week without needing to recharge.- Wide-angle and panorama image modes are an excellent (and very usable) bonus.- Very comfortable ergonomics and controls. While some cameras have quirky design flaws, the Cybershot fits like a glove.- No issues hooking it up to Windows or Linux to drag and drop files.Cons:- Image and video quality are not top of the line, particularly in low-light scenarios. If you are shopping for image quality, you'll want to spend a little more.- No touch screen, dual screen, or rotating screen gimmicks here. Not really a con, but consumers really do look for weird things these days.- While the zoom is quite impressive, it gets so shaky towards the end that it is unlikely to ever produce a good shot.

Reviews.Title: Sony camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This a really good digital camrta! I always look for Sony products when purchading digital equipment. The item arrived as scheduled. I love it!

Reviews.Title: Buena camara
Reviews.Author: Jean Carlos
Reviews.Content: La camara cumple con mis espectativas, toma muy buenas fotos, es usable y el precio es bueno. El producto llego a tiempo y en el color seleccionado.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied!
Reviews.Author: Lori
Reviews.Content: I didn't ask for too much from a camera, but i was very satisfied with this Cybershot! =) Super convenient, there when i need it. Also, the video quality is excellent!

Reviews.Title: You get what you expect
Reviews.Author: Michael Kung
Reviews.Content: It's obviously not a DSLR but it takes pretty decent pictures. It's small so that's good. It's pretty slow when taking pictures from pressing the button to actually taking the picture so that kind of sucks, but if things aren't moving at all it's good. Just know what you're paying for and it'll meet expectations.

Reviews.Title: Overall a good purchase but the lense has had a bit of trouble
Reviews.Author: EarlyReader
Reviews.Content: This camera has been in general a great value, atleast for what I wanted.  The video isn't of the highest quality but I rarely use it, so it doesnt bother me.  The panoramic feature has allowed me to caputre amazing landscapes while I've been traveling.  I will admit I'm not exactly gentle with the camera but I have begun to have problems with the lense not opening and I have not even had it a year, luckily I bought a 2 year warranty

Reviews.Title: Very nice compact camera
Reviews.Author: R. ZUNIGA
Reviews.Content: Love this camera because its small and fast, gives very good pictures and good video. I had previous models of the same bramd but this is even better than I ever thought. Easy to use. Compact, lightweigh, good batery life.Worth the money

Reviews.Title: Okay and simple but feels cheap and panorama view is limited.
Reviews.Author: Brad Salazar
Reviews.Content: The camera is okay, seems to do the job but it feels like a cheap camera, poorly made. The other complaint is that the panorama mode greatly cuts off part of the image. It's not like you're taking a bunch of standard pictures and stitching them together automatically. Instead it's like just the center of the shots are stitched together so panorama mode is a little misleading. I wouldn't run to get this camera unless you're not very picky then its fine.

Reviews.Title: Malfunctioned right after warranty expired- over $100 to repair
Reviews.Author: Steven D Porterfield
Reviews.Content: I've never owned a Sony camera before; I may never own one again:I enjoyed the ease of use, and the picture quality was good for a point-and-shoot camera.  I also really liked that it's smaller than a smartphone and easy to carry around in my pocket.HOWEVER, right after the 1-yr warranty expired (13 months to be exact) the lens malfunctioned and it no longer takes pictures.  It just displays a message on the screen indicating a fatal error.  I'm very disappointed in the quality of this camera.  Sony said it will cost more than $100 to repair it, which is something I'm not willing to do out of principal.Summary:$200 retail$110 repair after one year=$310 for a simple point-and-shoot camera.Maybe this one was a lemon, but this camera turned out to be a disappointment and wasn't worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I've ever owned.
Reviews.Author: college_chicky
Reviews.Content: This camera is by far my favorite digital camera that I have ever owned or used. I have owned this camera for 2 years I think maybe 3. I have had the best pictures taken with this camera. Its good for far away pics as well as close up ones. I went to China for two months and one of the venders at the Shangahi Science and Technology took it from me. I was so sad to have lost my friend and all the pics I had on it. But with out a doubt I will be getting a new one just like it. This camera has gone everywhere with me. If your looking for a little tank for a camera this one is it! I had dropped it several times in the past few years that I've owned it. I hope my new one is just as good as my last one.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera!!
Reviews.Author: Isaac LLG
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera, although is not entirely a point and shoot. You need to get use to it, and to all its features but once you've done it you can take great images and videos. I totally recomend it.

Reviews.Title: Photo quality makes up for the rest
Reviews.Author: Alison Fox
Reviews.Content: I have always been a fan of Sony products, so after reading and reading and READING reviews for all digital cameras in my price range, I narrowed it down to this one.  The first time I used it was on a 9-day trip to the Carolina Coast.  I am not an expert photographer.  This purchase was to satisfy your average camera needs (girls night out, family get togethers, vacation, my cats).  The reviews I read warned me of the lag when turning the camera on and when you can snap a photo.  There is also a lag between photo snapping (which directly relates to the time it takes between when you take a photo and it comes up on the review screen).  It seems like an eternity.I have tried the panorama setting a few times and I guess I just don't know how to do it right.  My photos ended up looking like I was peeking through a peep hole... REALLY big on the left and right and normal sized in the middle.  I did not try to video setting.My biggest pet peeve was the review button.  On my last Sony camera, I just had to press the "left" button to view the last photo I took.  There is no option on this camera to just view your last photo.  You have to review all of them and then select the photo you want to review.The menu is pretty easily navigated once you play around and get used to it.  I think it helped having used a Sony camera before.  I did not like not being able to control the flash if the camera was set to automatically choose the photo setting (Nighttime, Portrait, Landscape, etc).  Then if you chose your own setting and changed the flash to anything but Automatic, it would stay at that setting if you switched the photo setting back to Automatic.  Very annoying.Zooming left much to be desired.  It would zoom too much and I would try to zoom in or out just a little and it would just jump to extremes.  It seems like it was programmed to jump like that upon first zoom and then when you hit it a couple times, I think it realizes you just want to zoom in or out a little.  So after I have waited for the shutter lag from my last picture and then fiddled with the zoom for the next shot... there's a good chance I've lost my photo op.But I'm not made of money, so I will just live with it and adjust for it.  Because what makes the camera worth it is the photo quality.  I developed my vacation photos using Snapfish (and the developer always plays a small role in photo quality), but I don't know if they could be too much worse if I got a bad development job.  The colors were crystal clear and the images were sharp.  Details could be easily seen in the close-ups and I just have no complaints on photo quality.  They were bright and vibrant and helped all my family and friends see how beautiful the Carolinas actually are.I can't say I would recommend the camera because of its shortcomings, but the photo quality is excellent and if you don't care about the rest, it is definitely a nice little camera.

Reviews.Title: works as described
Reviews.Author: lloyd
Reviews.Content: picture taking is of very good quality.shutter speed and automatic focus is pretty darn fast...everything works and does as it say's in the description.The only thing that's not so good is the quality in the panorama..the quality is not as clear as the regular pictures..but over all..I am satisfied with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: zaz
Reviews.Content: Amazing camera, love the image stabilization which sets sony apart from other cameras, burst mode can take fast pics the picture quality is amazing and the picture quality does not decrease with zoom like some other cameras, Loving every minute of using it!!!! only wish it had a further zoom, otehrwise a 5 star product

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: NikkiUs1346
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a high end quality digital camera for my  84 year Dad and after quite a bit of research found Sony to be the right fit for him. I got the best price on Amazon. The camera is great for everyday use taking photos, videos, etc. The picture quality as well as the video beats my Nikon. My Dad is very happy with the camera. I have it the 4 star just because of the software download which is not as user friendly as my Nikon. The order arrived as promised along with all the cables.

Reviews.Title: pretty good!
Reviews.Author: Dragonslayx7
Reviews.Content: i love this camera. it works good, and the quality is amazing. i am a photographer, and this was my first camera ^-^ i outgrew it fast, but i don't have money so i'm still using it haha. the flash is a little.... extremely bright, actually, so it messes up colors sometimes -.- i have had to return it a couple of times for breaking, but it is usually my fault. it is extremely small, but the latch is not that strong. as far as i can think of, that is all of the bad. the HD video is great, 720p HD. panorama works AMAZING you just have to have a steady hand. at first, unless experienced, pics will look bad. you have to get used to it and they turn out amazing. i have a deviant art, xdragonslayx7x.deviantart.com/gallery/ <-- there are a lot of examples of pictures i have taken with it. zoom works good, and the component cables are very useful. i use them all the time. it is really nice to have a capture card haha. the battery life is pretty short, it does get annoying when it dies, but it is a great point and shoot camera, and i would definitely recommend it

Reviews.Title: Great Handy camera...
Reviews.Author: YanBatausai
Reviews.Content: i like this camera..it simple to use and very light..and the thing that i like is the panoramic view..it was great..i think, no need to buy other DSLR anymore..

Reviews.Title: nice for the price
Reviews.Author: Freddie
Reviews.Content: This camera is pretty good.  The only gripe I have is with night shots.  I expect a little lag with a point and shoot, but there is just too much noise for my liking.  All other features are alright although the video may fall a little short to some expectations.

Reviews.Title: Sony DSC-W350
Reviews.Author: William H. Brown "film score junkie"
Reviews.Content: Great camera for quick snap shots. Small size and easy of make it easy to carry everywhere. This is my second camera I carry everywhere. If I need to take important pictures I fall back on my Nikon D80.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after a good experience with an earlier model.  The automatic settings are a lot better, which results in better photos: I like this camera's picture quality a lot more than others (I've tried Kodak and Canon point and shoots).  The video lets you zoom in and out (something the earlier model didn't have) and the panorama function works like a breeze.I haven't had time to grasp all of the features, but a couple of weeks with the camera has made very happy with my purchase :)

Reviews.Title: Great camera in a small package
Reviews.Author: Richard Crouch
Reviews.Content: Most of us today have multi-task devices--phone/camera/computer/GPS.  While some of these take OK pictures, they're still not usually of really GOOD quality.  This camera is a great addition to your device arsenal.  It is very small and lightweight (can fit in a shirt pocket), shoots in great quality of stills and video, and you can get a lot on the memory stick.  I have an 8GB stick, and used it as our main camera on a recent vacation taking a combination of VGA video and stills.  It took almost 8 days to fill it up, and that was at the highest still picture quality and VGA video.Unlike some digital cameras, this one is FAST.  Others take several seconds to focus.  While this one will, with more time, fine tune settings if you let it, you can also literally point and shoot and get really good quality. By taking a few additional seconds of partially pushing the shutter button, the camera will fine tune the focus, flash, and exposure--but if something happens quickly, you won't miss the shot while the camera decides how it WOULD have taken the picture, if it had been ready!All in all, I found it to be an excellent value for a very compact camera.

Reviews.Title: Sony camera review
Reviews.Author: tennis mom
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  I have not played with the features much, but I took it on a trip shortly after I bought it and it worked great.  It is easy to use and the battery lasts a long time.  It's size makes it easy to carry.  I would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed with picture quality
Reviews.Author: Stephan Jan
Reviews.Content: Like most, I researched and read and read and researched.  I also went to the local Best Buy, and handled as many cameras as possible.  I was looking for the smallest possible camera in the under $150 range.  I previously owned a Nikon Coolpix S1 that I really loved, but one too many days in a hot car in the sun in Palm Springs and the viewing screen fried.  Also have a Canon PowerShot A610--with 4 AA rechargeable batteries and a reversible viewing screen, this puppy lasts forever.  However, it's BIG.  I was looking for a camera I could always carry in my pocket to record video testimonials.  The ultra-tiny and light Sony would, I thought, fill the bill.When I opened it and started playing with the controls and settings, it seemed to me to be designed for teen aged girls.  Nothing wrong with that, just not for me.  The principal settings on the still shots register big smiles, small smiles, and medium smiles for automatic shots.  And smiles by 1 person and 2.  I guess after all of the far more relevant (to me) settings on the Nikon, this was a disappointment, and set the tone for the rest of the issues I had with it. This camera is probably better for my daughter at Palm Springs High School, who loves to hold the camera in her hand and get shots of her and her girl friends together.  Definitely not the type for my web page!I am very disappointed by the quality of the still photos.  I have set most of the settings to automatic to (ideally) reduce user errors in picking the wrong settings.  But my indoor shots are coming out ... yucky.  The color balance is way off, the steadyshot or whatever on this camera doesn't seem to work that well, and the pictures of people are just not very clear.  I also miss the on-board processing that my Nikon S1 had--it would correct everything and give me a choice of keeping it, erasing the original, or keeping both.  AND I could see if the picture was salvageable.  AND it had about 26 alternative scenes from which I could select.All an all, I'm just plain disappointed with the camera.  I'm going to give it to my daughter, and order a Nikon.  That about says it all.

Reviews.Title: Sony DSC350
Reviews.Author: Kevin B. Davis
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small footprint digital camera for work with a good wide angle lens. I have been using an older DSC P50 for years with an attachable wide angle lens. I need an wide angle lens since I tend to take pictures of large items, offshore structures, from a short distance. It appeared this camera fit the bill and it turns out it has a wider angle view than my P50 with the wide angle attachment. Very pleased with the operation and can also use the panorama feature for those areas where I still can't get everything in one shot. Small size, good features, just what I was looking for. Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Sony DSC-W350 14.1MP
Reviews.Author: Brenda S. Sydnor "mommiedearest53"
Reviews.Content: Very light and easy to use.  Great Pictures!  It uses squares to focus on faces.  No blurrs.  I love it.  Haven't had a chance to use the panorama or video features yet. But so far I am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Good camera bad conectivity
Reviews.Author: oconel
Reviews.Content: This is a very good camera and I'm very satisfied with the pictures it takes, I like that it's tiny and can take it everywhere with me.But the connectivity for this camera is very bad:- it doesn't use a mini-usb or a micro-usb port, instead you have to carry around this bulky cable http://www.amazon.com/ABC-Products%C2%AE-Original-connection-Cyber-Shot/dp/B003X9U6OK/ref=sr_1_19?s=electronics&ie;=UTF8&qid;=1300266955&sr;=1-19 (or use a card reader, which is the best option).- The battery won't recharge by simply plugiing the camera to the computer, you have to take the battery out and recharge it on the charger.I can't understand why such a small camera needs so much bulky equipment to be carried around.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: mtordeaux
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera but only problem that i found is that when you are recording a video and you zoom something, the noise on the video y very loud.Also, i don't know how to take pictures in SEPIA mode and grey scale of colors. Thats it. I recommend it any way.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: DLK2011
Reviews.Content: This camera is great !  I purchased this camera a week ago because my 10 year old Sony camera was starting to give me trouble.  This camera is so lightweight and has many improved features over my old camera.  I really like the ability to take panoramic pictures.I chose this camera based on the quick shutter speed, ease of use, and the lithium ion battery versus AA batteries.Please be aware the camera itself doesn't put the date onto the pictures.  You have to use the software that came with the camera to add this.  It can be a pain in the butt if you are adding the dates to hundreds of pictures but the ability to crop pictures/add date/etc via the included software is amazing !

Reviews.Title: Best camera so far
Reviews.Author: SmartConsumer
Reviews.Content: This is something we bought for the house. It takes great photos and is easy to carry around. I really low how small it is, yet all the buttons are easy to use and it doesn't feel cramped. Great picture quality as well!

Reviews.Title: Not Bad!!!!
Reviews.Author: rk
Reviews.Content: Well, this camera has served me well so far and the quality of the pictures is definatley worth it. The only complaint that I have is thatone of my buttons with the arrows button has come loose and I am unable to click any of the arrows now!

Reviews.Title: Decent little camera!
Reviews.Author: EiNST3iN
Reviews.Content: Pros: Excepts SDHC cards now.Smaller than a canon 940is but is slightly thicker. New menu system is simple to use. Good picture quality, Battery consumption is very good compared to Sony's previous models. Takes great indoor shots.Cons: I wish they kept the mode dial on this model.Summary: I bought this camera specifically for taking pictures of house's and properties which my Canon 940is failed to perform well at. This camera is able to take excellent picture indoors of rooms and architecture without any blur. It also takes good portrait pictures as well. I love the new design it is very small and the new panoramic function makes taking panoramic photos a breeze unlike canon models where you have to manually align every photo. All in all I am very impressed by the new design.

Reviews.Title: Nice One
Reviews.Author: Munir
Reviews.Content: I used this camera.... A wonderful camera .. excellent features..  Very Crispy ...Koool <,,Buy it u will not forget...but if u go for W370 it will be even better

Reviews.Title: FABTASTIC PERFECT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: L. Herman "Lorriefla12"
Reviews.Content: It's easy to use, it takes great videos and photos it's not complicated, I love it and I love the pink cam case you can get to match itthis is top shelf, less fuss and just logical fun, IT DOES EXACTLY WHAT IT IS SUPPOSED TO DO and it LASTS!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Kili
Reviews.Content: Good price. Very light. Panoramic view option is a wonderful feature. Not so good when taking pics on the move. Still shots are superb. LCD size is good enough. I always buy SONY cameras for quality/price and this one is up to par.

Reviews.Title: This is an amazing point-and-shoot camera.
Reviews.Author: colorizzle
Reviews.Content: For me, i like a lot of color and depth in my pictures so I can use them as my desktop background here and there. This is one of the fastest snapshot cameras I have used and is perfect for taking pics of moving objects. All in all I'm extremely happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: I like it.
Reviews.Author: Meghan T. Gloe "trezrock73"
Reviews.Content: Compared to my previous Fujifilm camera this one is amazing.  The panorama setting is complicated to figure out.  But I just want to take snapshots so it doesnt bother me.  I have only had it for a few days so we will see how it holds up.  So far so good.

Reviews.Title: Great Price... Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: David Oseda "David Oseda"
Reviews.Content: The camera is Amazing... I bought 2 of them, one for another person, and one for me, and It is just Great!! I recommend it to anyone...!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent little camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: K. Myers "Magnumsmom"
Reviews.Content: The Zeiss lens really allows this camera to use it's 14.1 sensorto create wonderfully clear pictures.  It's a nice camera with anexcellent lens at an exceptional price point.

Reviews.Title: sony camera
Reviews.Author: Cathy L. Kern
Reviews.Content: Christmas gift for my husband.  Does not have a lot of interest in technology but is advancing with encouragement from family members.  He opened this camera and every day he is excited that he has learned something new on it.

Reviews.Title: Good Point and Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: Aazath
Reviews.Content: There are lot of choices available in point and shoot camera and its great fun reviewing and comparing each of these products. These were my requirements - need manual buttons and no touch screen, need to have some ampunt of optical zoom, it should not be so light that i forget the camera or drop it somewhere. I found Sony Cybershot and Canon IXUS to be good competitors so decided to compare each of these features. Already had a Sony Cybershot (bought 4 years back - 7MP) so decided to upgrade it as this came with Carl Zeis lens.1. Operating this camera is quite easy - One of the goog features of CyberShot series2. I love the Smiley shutter option and the wide angle shots when i try my best to match SLRs while covering landscapes3. The contrast and color of the pictures are too good - That made me fan of this PS Camera. Do not use digital zoom as image resultion will get distorted - always go for optical zoom.4. Steady shot feature is also goodSome of my friends say thet have a bad experience with the camera - I have never come across any such situation and love every picture I had taken with this one. Be careful with these cameras, once you drop them or there is a slight scratch along the lens, the zoom feature will not work - at times shutter will not work - You will have to lose out your camera

Reviews.Title: Pleased
Reviews.Author: K. Sadler
Reviews.Content: This camera is pretty good. Sometimes the pictures are blurry. I believe it's because the settings can be easily changed which causes the focus to get out of alignment. But that problem is not too bad. Other than that the camera is light weight, chic, and overall good. The only other complaint would be that the memory card seems to fill up really quickly, especially if you use the video camera. My husband says that it's because the pictures are higher quality which takes more memory. The same memory card in my old camera could store up to 300 pics and this one I am lucky to get 50 pics before having to upload the pics to my computer and erasing the memory card.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: 87userid
Reviews.Content: Got the camera for my wife for Christmas. She doesn't like to mess with the settings, so I needed something that she can just point and shoot. The camera works great. The few times we have used it, the pictures have been bright and clear. Definitely a good product for the price. No complaints so far and of course Amazon shipped it on the day they said they would, even a few days before Christmas. Great service.

Reviews.Title: Great Quality
Reviews.Author: Stacey
Reviews.Content: I am thoroughly happy with this purchase.  I am not a professional photographer by any means but I just love to take pictures and this camera takes photos with excellent quality.  That, coupled with quick delivery, made it a great purchase.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera!
Reviews.Author: janet
Reviews.Content: Small and lightweight and the pictures look very nice. The flash is a little bright but you can adjust it.

Reviews.Title: It is the best relationship price + quality
Reviews.Content: In this average price ranking the sony cybershot dsc-w350 is the best of w series. Actually i have the DSC-w220 by sony with 12 MP but it do not have 14 mp as the w350. I love sony because is the camera that solve problems. With 1280px in video record resolutions I THINK THAT 5 STARS ARE NOT ENOUGH TO QUALIFY, ARE NOT SUFFICIENT. Always i bought from international territory and I can not complain of sony. Is the best brand in digital cameras

Reviews.Title: Great pictures
Reviews.Author: R. Ramos
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures and has many great features.  The only problem I have is that the zoom is not slow and steady.  It jumps, so you can't gradually zoom in on something when taking a video.

Reviews.Title: What we were looking for!
Reviews.Author: carolp
Reviews.Content: small, practice, easy to use. great hd videos and photos!i dindt paid to much attetion to the zoom i would prefer more!

Reviews.Title: Not bad, but...
Reviews.Author: MaR
Reviews.Content: So I've been a fan of Sony Cybershot cameras for a while, and despite being extremely pleased with the W55 I decided to try this one, and honestly I regret it. I agree with another reviewer, pictures seem washed out often, and I was hoping it'd be "quicker" since I'm trying to capture my baby's precious moments.I do like to Panoramic setting, but another thing I HATE is the video format (MP4). I know, most people love the ease to transfer to YouTube and all that, but I have always disliked Quicktime and if I change the format the video loses quality, so I'm kinda lost here.Don't get me wrong, for the price this is a very good camera, however I was expecting an upgrade and honestly I can't deny I miss the W55. Good thing my mom has it and I get to use it once in a while!

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: A. Levanti
Reviews.Content: Great camera, take pictures as easy as you want it to, need to read the manual if your not familiar with sony products before using it, but once you figure it out your idea of taking good pictures takes a pro will be fade away

Reviews.Title: Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Airee
Reviews.Content: Item arrived in the condition it was said to be in. Photos did not seem to mimic the actual item up close however. However, photos get taken well, but videos don't seem to be as good of quality as the photos. Quality matches the price. Satisfied.

Reviews.Title: The BIG midget
Reviews.Author: Robert W. Scheuerman "R W Scherm"
Reviews.Content: This camera has everything, including taking panoramic pictures that are completed in the camera (no stitching in the computer is necessary).  The pictures are above average in quality and clarity, good enough to use for publishing in a newsletter or a commercial newspaper.  Taking panoramic pictures is very easy.  It is small enough to go anywhere you go and the price was right.Sony DSC-W350 14.1MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Zoom with Optical Steady Shot Image Stabilization and 2.7 inch LCD (Blue)

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Alberto
Reviews.Content: Great camera, relly good one,, need bye an memory, another  litium battery and one case for save it all. The zoom is not the best but, tecnology - price is one of the best deals to do.

Reviews.Title: Camera ease
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: The ease of use is remarkable.  We replaced an older digital camera.  This one has many more features and most are "automatic."  Very convenient, easy to use and great picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Love
Reviews.Author: J. M. Wnuk "Mrs. Johnson"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this dainty little camera! The color is cute, and it functions outstandingly! Crisp clear photos, no blurs even when I purposefully moved. love the panoramic feature! Can't wait to use it when I go to Hawaii later this year! Love it!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Courtney Bradbury
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a replacement for the older 7.1mp model. It is a lot smaller and lighter but the basic layout of the camera is still simple and easy to use. I have yet to try all the feature or attempt a print, but all indications are this is a great little basic point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: works perfect for me
Reviews.Author: Ravi
Reviews.Content: Apart from the still pictures the movie mode which i use to shoot videos is excellent and overall its exceeds my expectation.

Reviews.Title: HD function must be played back through camera
Reviews.Author: AenJailies
Reviews.Content: There is very little to dislike about this camera.The design is ultra sleek and the panorama view is like having a fish eye lens.The ability to capture images at night under artificial light is impressive.For me this is keeper.One issue is the HD playback.I generally record and playback directly from the flash card through my card reader on my computer.The VGA plays back fine but the HD formats are not recognized by my windows media player. I was able to get the HD to play using Quick time.The other is the noisy video Zoom, not only is it noisy but it is anything but smooth. The Zoom jumps from one extreme to the other so quickly there is very little ability to control it.The camera appears to be sturdy but the care warnings make it seem quite fragile and subject to damage form a variety of normal situations.Would I recommend this camera?For snap shots, and youtube videos it will work fine.The panorama view is top notch. Amazing performance under artificial light.Not the best choice for shooting videos that require the use of a zoom.

Reviews.Title: Great Pocket Camera!
Reviews.Author: heatherdehn
Reviews.Content: Love this camera! We use the panoramic shot all the time and love the option! One complaint my daughter has is you cannot shoot in black & white or sepia but this is so easy to change later it doesn't matter much. shutter speed is nice, it take a second for the display to pop up but it's only the display, the actual picture snaps fast!

Reviews.Title: Slightly disappointed
Reviews.Author: J. Wu
Reviews.Content: My family has been a Sony family for a few years now.  My dad has one of the older cybershot models and I have a Sony Cybershot DSC-H7, both which are fantastic cameras. I was expecting a camera of the same caliber, but just 2 weeks after I bough the DSC-W350, the quality of the pictures became completely distorted.  The coloration changed so that it would have tinted yellow outlines around certain objects.  It took about 3 weeks for them to ship it to the Sony factory and back, (at least I bought a warranty from Best Buy).  Although the picture quality is fixed, the camera itself lags a lot; it switches modes back and forth a few times by itself when you open the camera sometimes.  It also takes a while to take pictures.  I'm not sure if it is just my camera, but it is really annoying, and I'm starting to wish I tried out a Canon camera.The quality of the pictures (when it wasn't tinted yellow and distorted) are good though, probably the one good quality of this camera.  The panorama shots are pretty sweet as well.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: H. Leonard
Reviews.Content: I previously owned a Canon but it was stolen. At first I was angry but realized it was an opportunity to replace my 5 yr old camera for a newer model. I initially was going to get another Canon but read many reviews stating their picture quality was not as good as it used to be. I happened to see this camera for sale for only $129 and gave it a chance. I have been pleased with the results and now feel like someone did me a favor.

Reviews.Title: I like it!
Reviews.Author: S. Prokop "Cartoon Lover"
Reviews.Content: I've only had this camera for a few days- so far I love it.  I haven't had the opportunity to really dig in and get to know all the settings, but after my vacation maybe I can update the review.Some of the pictures seemed washed out and some pics looked clearer as the software was bringing up the picture.  But I think it's because I'm not used to any of the settings yet.  It has way more features than I would probably need for a point and shoot camera.Love the color and the size- for some reason looking at the picture of this camera it seemed a little larger to me, but it's actually quite small.  Smaller than my W55- which I loved.The panoramic feature is nice, and hopefully I'll use it on my vacation- and the macro is pretty good too so far.  I just have to get used to the face detection, flash etc.

Reviews.Title: good indoors / problems outdoors
Reviews.Author: RDCO
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a couple of months ago to replace a Sony DSC  w300 which had fallen out of my pocket while bicycling.The DSC W370 is smaller, has a bit more resolution, and a variety of new computerized recognition and stability features. None of these obviously improve the results, but they are entertaining to watch (as faces are identified and scenes guessed at).The smaller size make the camera even more portable, you can put it in the front pocket of your jeans or in a suit pocket and pull it out for a quick shot whenever the scene demands a photo or two.The camera takes very reliable shots indoors at somewhat lower light than the w300, and with the somewhat wider view, it can fit more of what's interesting into the frame. There is little camera lag and the results are normally very good except that the flash will--as most small cameras do--burn out the details of people and objects that are a bit too close.The main problem with the camera is that outdoors the lack of a view finder means that you shoot blind a good deal of the time. That is, often, you literally point and shoot because you can't see anything in the LCD screen. Other times, you have some rough idea about what is in the scene, but can't really see how its processing the colors etc, because everything looks so washed out when shooting in bright sunlight. In most cases, the camera calculates correctly and the shot is what you had in mind. However, in some cases, objects literally disappear from the photo that were clear as a bell with your eyes. For example, I took a "fine" shot of the Washington Monument and Jefferson Memorial yesterday in bright sunlight, and when I reviewed the photos they were not there at all--evidently the digital equivalent of UV (excessive contrast?) burned them right out of the picture. (I cannot remember that happening with the w300.)Nonetheless, most times the results are very good and together with the size--big enough that it does not get lost in your hand or pocket, but small enough to ignore while walking around--makes it a good compromise.  If it had an "old fashioned" view or bright lcd, I would give it a 5.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't last and Sony doesn't stand by it
Reviews.Author: Benjamin T Caldwell
Reviews.Content: We were initially very satisfied with the camera. It's a point-and-shoot, so there are typical compromises in terms of customization and image distortion. It was sleek and took good snapshots though.That was for three months of normal use - no exposure to rain, no water spills on it, nothing. After three months, we noticed that the autofocus light was stuck on so we sent it in for repair. A week later, they call back to let us know that the unit had corrosion on the inside and so the warranty was voided. This is after three months of gentle use, with the camera traveling in a case and again, with no exposure to water. So a total loss after we'd done everything right to take care of it.This is the second time I've had to write off a Sony product, and it'll be a long time before I buy anything else they make.

Reviews.Title: SONY failed with this one.
Reviews.Author: Logan
Reviews.Content: I want to start by saying that I've always been impressed by SONY products before owning this camera. That being said, I'm very disapointed with this camera. I replaced a very beat up Casio Exilim with this camera. The picture quality is not as good as the 12.1 casio (how is that possible?), and the movie mode stability is not as good. I will say that it does auto-focus very fast though. Over the years the old casio was dropped, wet, and used hard, and it still works (backup camera). Today after less than 8 months the Sony just quit. It won't turn on. It has never been abused and spent most of the time on a tripod. At least I won't have to tolerate the mediocre photos now.

Reviews.Title: Cyber-shot camera and Bad Sony software
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: This camera seems to work great untill install the software that comes with it. It over wrote the software I have been using for about three years with my Sony camcorder.Now I can't make standard dvd's with the new Cyber-shot camera or my HD camcorder. I have contacted Sony and they gave me a link to an update in the software but that didnt work eather. This camera has been nothing but a waist of alot of time. Hope I can get my money back and I will go back to my old software and HD Camcorder.If you already have a Sony camera that is working with the PMB software there is a good chance the software that comes with this Cyber-shot camera will screw it all up.

Reviews.Title: I dont like it
Reviews.Author: pedro
Reviews.Content: Among the three cameras that I already own, this is who possess less autonomy..The battery is empty so fast! Horor one. do not buy it again. A pity not read a review like this before.thanks

Reviews.Title: Buy for better video
Reviews.Author: Tim W Parish
Reviews.Content: I had purchased this camera as well as the Sony WX5 from somewhere else.  I ended up returning both.  A trend in small cameras nowadays is to rely on image stabilization to lower the "normal" shutter speed to 1/30.  That way the ISO can be set back another stop without using a flash.  This actually seems to work fine, but my small daughters don't sit still long enough for 1/30, so I returned the cameras.This camera performed well otherwise.  I really liked the panaroma and the settings options.  The pictures were great.  The WX5 did just as well but didn't "feel" as good.  The WX5 has higher resolution video and some 3-D function.  If you don't care about that, buy the W350 and save $100.In the end, I bought a canon SD4000.  With the right program settings I was able to get it to use 1/60 most of the time at ISO 125 with flash indoors.  I really drives me crazy that it took me four cameras to find one that would take a sharp picture of a moving object without ISO 600-800 distortions.  My Sony Cybershot P200 from five years ago still takes sharper pictures than any compact I have touched since 2007.  Sorry for the rant.  Good luck!

Reviews.Title: Cumbersome Software, OK Picture Quaity
Reviews.Author: JFMP
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace an older Sony model.  Whereas the older model had the presettings readily available on a handy dial, this one requires browsing through the internal software, two and three clicks away.  Unlike previous models, the picture settings can only be accessed by fully turning on the camera and drawing out the lens, doing away with power-off pre-setting.  What this means is that you'll need 5-7 seconds more to take a shot.The picture quality is ok. If there is motion stabilization, it's negligible. Anything but a steady hand will make pictures come out out of focus. In the non-automatic settings, the pictures take three-to-four second to capture. The panorama setting turns out very low-quality photos, and won't produce anything more than a gimmicky shot.Most annoyingly, it eschews standard connectors to the computer, requiring its very own cable cord. Leave it at home and you're out of luck.I regret having bought this camera. May well be my last Sony cam.

Reviews.Author: Sem
Reviews.Content: I like it, i think it was fairly smaller than my previous camera that I owned. Panorama is a new feature for me, but it could use quite a bit of improving. Other than that I think that I think the pictures come out nicely and really detailed.

Reviews.Title: SONY always innovating
Reviews.Author: gativelo
Reviews.Content: Beatiful camera, zoom acceptable, the size is very small, looks beatiful!!! The panorama funtion is exceptional and innovator. The memory is SD or SPD, is your choose and is an plus to sony. I recommend it!LATINOAMERICA: La camara es una preciosidad, la funcion panorama es brutal, su resolucion, colores, tamaño del cam, su calidad es excelente, sin decir mas es una eleccion correcta escoger esta camara, se las recomiendo. Sony ha dejado su soberbia y ha incluido la opcion de poder utilizar SPD o SD memory, esto es todo una renovacion de sus productos.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase!
Reviews.Author: Marcos Perez
Reviews.Content: Totally recommended!It's a Very light weighted, Nice pocket camera, with great features specially the Sweep Panorama!

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Gisele
Reviews.Content: Good píctures and video. I think the videos are the best part with nice quality and sound. It's possible to take panoramic pictures.

Reviews.Title: exelente producto
Reviews.Author: Carlos Orozco
Reviews.Content: la camara es la mejor q he podido tener, he comprado varias fujifilm j28, j38, y estas no son buenas en fotos nocturnas, pero la sony dscw350 es super buena en fotos de noche,,, posee un menu interactivo y super facil de manejar, sony es sony,,, la recomeindo totalmente, ademas la compre por 139$

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: M. Wong
Reviews.Content: Good little camera and inexpensive.  One thing though there is no date printed on the picture like the Canon

Reviews.Title: Sony is still the best
Reviews.Author: WDJ
Reviews.Content: Sony has up to date design on digital cameras. They are functional and good looking. They have to be careful not to design the cameras too small. Small size has a limit. It can become not functional, hard to operate, easy to get lost, hard to find,and difficult to manage.

Reviews.Title: This camera is nice
Reviews.Author: Anderson C Eastnond
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera recently and to my surprise its smaller than the before models but compliments any pocket.The shutter speed is slow between shots but the hand shaken technology is superb.For starters or camera novices this is a good camera especially in the auto mode

Reviews.Title: not pinned my expectations
Reviews.Author: Enrique Henriquez "Enrique"
Reviews.Content: Attention to the seller very good but the camera though is 14 megapixel photos are not of good quality and the night shots are horrible, I've used other sony models and they are excellent not that sony is going to lately because this model is the worst.

Reviews.Title: It takes horrible pictures, and that's all there is to it
Reviews.Author: D. Shanthikumar
Reviews.Content: I gave my new Cybershot a 4-month test period because at first the pictures were so bad that I thought I was just using it wrong.  I wasn't.  The camera is just that bad.  (And I've had other people use it with the same results.)Here are the specifics:1. The flash is so bright that if it flashes you lose almost all contrast.2. The camera cannot take photos indoors or in medium or lower light without the flash.  They turn out blurry or grainy or both.  (And when I say grainy, I mean that in a 2x3 inch version you can still tell it's grainy.  Not just in some super-blown-up version.)3. The colors end up all wrong with either the flash, or without the flash indoors.4. There is an entire light range where the auto-flash does not go off, but without the flash the pictures are so blurry that I just want to force the flash, even though I know it will bleach the picture.  Well, there's no force-flash option.  So in that entire light range I just have to give up and accept that I will never get pictures.The pros: It is small and cute and the pictures are good in bright mid-day Southern CA sunshine.Bottom line:  If you only plan to take photos outside during the day in relatively bright sunlight, this is a great camera for you. Otherwise, get something else.  You're probably better off buying disposables from the drug store than this one.

Reviews.Title: sony digital camera
Reviews.Author: lefty
Reviews.Content: this is a replacement for another sony that i own.  i was interested in a camera that had a rechargeable battery and one that would accept the memory card that i have.

Reviews.Title: Plugging it into the computer does not charge the battery.
Reviews.Author: Tony Lee
Reviews.Content: The camera is okay to use and works fine, but the thing that bothers me is that it does not charge the battery when you plug it in a USB port. Why would SONY do this to us?

Reviews.Title: best price in the market
Reviews.Author: Haziel "Hazieldo"
Reviews.Content: I been looking all over for the silver color camera and couldn't find it anywhere at a decent price, but here...

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money!!!
Reviews.Author: WCC
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to replaced a Sony digital which was destroyed by water. It's small, which is a plus but that's where the positives end. This camera takes out of focus photographs inside and outside. After six months of playing with all the functions in attempts to get better photographs I realized that I would just have to be satisfied with substandard photographs. None of the photographs I ever took with this camera were sharp.

Reviews.Title: a camera had bad software
Reviews.Author: Gene Hung
Reviews.Content: We have the camera for less than a month and already had two incidents that I can't retrieve the images. One time is was the images were damaged and other time the entire data set for the day was gone.

Reviews.Title: Took back
Reviews.Author: jeres
Reviews.Content: My husband bought me this camera for my birthday.  After almost 3 months of feeling like I would "get used to it" or "maybe if I read the instruction manual one more time.." I took it back (thanks to Costco's liberal return policy).  The two main reasons I didn't like it were: the shutter speed was really slow and right after you take a picture, it only shows it on the screen for like 2 seconds, not enough time to see if you got a good picture.  If you are just a point and shoot type like me, this camera is not for you.

Reviews.Title: bought for a friend
Reviews.Author: Hugh Jazz
Reviews.Content: my friend gave me the cash and i bought this for him. i dont know if it worked or how good it is. i gave a 3 star rating.

Reviews.Title: Wouldn't recomend.
Reviews.Author: L. dierlam
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to use as an everyday camera to take pictures of my baby and family. It blurrs almost every picture. I have tried all the settings, and everything I can think of to improve the picture quality. I am so dissapointed in this camera and I regret buying it. It is takes pictures slowly, and if you are not PERFECTLY still it blurrs them. I am also not impressed with the picture quality on the rare occasion that it doesnt take a blurred picture. I have owned cony cybershots for years, and this is the only one I've ever had problems with.

Reviews.Title: Sony cybershot
Reviews.Author: shawn
Reviews.Content: I got the camera and the screen didnt work at all. I was very mad about this since i had paid so much for this camera.

Reviews.Title: Such a disappointment
Reviews.Author: NC Ad
Reviews.Content: This is my first time to write a review of any product.  I researched point-and-shoot cameras for two months before purchasing this camera.  The photo quality was terrible - bottom line.  The features were hard to use and disappointing.  Right out of the box the lens cover did not work- did not open or close all of the way.  The Sony support person was friendly, but the call took forever and did not fix the problem.  The USB connection cable was missing.  The camera was just terrible on all fronts.  I am thankful to Amazon for an easy refund.  I read a million reviews while shopping for a new camera and I hope this makes someone take another look at their options.  Canon, Nikon and definitely Samsung are better options.  Trust me.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: pitg
Reviews.Content: Sony DSC-W350 14.1MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Zoom with Optical Steady Shot Image Stabilization and 2.7 inch LCD (Blue)The quality of the photos is extremely disappointing.  I have an older version of the Sony Cyber-shot (with only 8MP) that takes much better quality shots.  This camera cost more and the photos are terrible.  I was so pleased with my first Cyber-shot and so unhappy with this one!

Reviews.Title: Be careful
Reviews.Author: BRJ "Ben"
Reviews.Content: Just made the purchase and returned to do the set up and it all went down hill from there. Even though I put the memory card in the screen kept flashing NO Memory card !I tried to contact sony customer service and got stuck in the loop of "all lines are busy ..."Call back. I looked on the online support and searched but No Help there either. The thin cover door for the battery is got to be a problem .It's so thin that if you put any pressure on it I'm sure it will break off. This camera is going back for a refund ASAP.

Reviews.Title: camera is ehh
Reviews.Author: Arturo Keossian
Reviews.Content: quality is goodyou can zoom in oand out on videos but zoom isnt that greatpanorama is good but when do you really use it?and slide show settings suck. it goes way too fast

Reviews.Title: DO NOT buy this camera!
Reviews.Author: Good Reviewer "Good Reviewer"
Reviews.Content: DO NOT buy this camera.  It is the worst camera I have ever owned.In the Easy Mode (auto), there are some great features.  The problemis that you have to push the shutter half way down to focus the picture.This takes too much time and you never great the picture you want.  It doeshave another mode where it just snaps the picture without the shutter delaybut then you do not have any of the options available in the Easy Mode.  The battery life is terrible and it takes forever to charge.  Buying a sparebattery is very expensive. The latch to the memory and battery compartmentis too small and dainty. Since you always have to open it up to get the battery outyou wonder how long before it breaks.  A good feature, the HD video is great and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great camera..can`t export photos
Reviews.Author: Thomas A. Sheets "digital world"
Reviews.Content: Nice pics,video ect...Thought it was everything all the other reviews had mentioned.That is until it came time to export photos to email or Facebook once imported to computer. Bottom line..I could`nt! Softwear is terrible for this camera.I will go back to Nikon ..I`ve NEVER been disappointed by that product.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy!
Reviews.Author: H. Yates "Hay"
Reviews.Content: It does not matter how the camera operates IF you NEED a 'SPECIAL' Sony card that fits no other gadget, a 'SPECIAL' Sony reader so consumers can access their photos. And worse the no consumer support, and if your camera is under warranty good luck getting any satisfaction. These are not suppose to be disposable cameras and they should last longer than 9 months! After your camera breaks you not only have that to toss but the card and reader! Sony corp are vampires out to suck your wallet dry DO NOT BUY!!  you have been warned.
